snippet: By calling for the creation of more than 200 cooperative businesses, the nation on Tuesday continued its process of opening its economy to free market ideas.
abstract: Cuban government authorizes wide range of co-ops, allowing workers to collectively open new businesses or take over existing state-run businesses in construction, transportation and other industries; new laws are latest step in process of opening Cuba's economy to free-market ideas.
lead_paragraph: By calling for the creation of more than 200 cooperative businesses, the nation on Tuesday continued its process of opening its economy to free market ideas.

headline.seo: New Laws For Cuban Co-ops Seen as Economic Progress
headline.main: Co-op Laws in Cuba Are Seen as Progress
headline.print_headline: Co-op Laws in Cuba Are Seen as Progress
